p: Figure 3 shows overall and country-level estimates. Overall CFR estimates were 71.9% (95% CI, 56.1–79.8%) and 75.1% (95% CI, 73.5–76.9%) unadjusted and without imputation, respectively ( Table 1, Figure 3). Guinea had the lowest rates, with CFRs of 65.6% (95% CI, 61.3–69.6%) and 65.8% (95% CI, 61.6–69.9%) unadjusted and without imputation, respectively. The Liberian rates were lower, with CFRs of 69.7% (95% CI, 55.6–78.7%) and 71.7% (95% CI, 67.2–75.6%) unadjusted and without imputation, respectively. Sierra Leone had the highest rates, with CFRs of 74.6% (95% CI, 52.2–84.3%) and 81.3% (95% CI, 79.3–83.3%) unadjusted and without imputation, respectively ( Table 1, Figure 3).
